newsitem.title: USA: Fruehauf reopens trailer assembly plant.
newsitem.headline: Fruehauf reopens trailer assembly plant.

text.p: Fruehauf Trailer Corp said on Tuesday that it reopened its dry freight van manufacturing plant in Fort Madison, Iowa.
The company's platform and dump trailer manufacturing plan in Scott County, Tennessee, has started sub-assembly work.
Fruehauf said the resumption of production at both assembly facilities represents a positive step in reorganization efforts under Chapter 11. It filed for Chapter 11 on October 7, 1996.
The company will be employing a total of 600 workers at plants in Iowa and Tennessee.
Fruehauf also named Chriss Street as chairman of the board of directors. The position had been vacant.
